message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MM, cs.CL 

Reasoning: 
- cs.IT (Information Theory): The paper deals with optimizing the transmit beamforming vectors and reflection coefficient vector to minimize the total transmit power, which is a fundamental problem in information theory. 
- cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture): The paper studies a downlink communication network with an intelligent reflecting surface (IRS) assisting the communication from the base station (BS) to all users, which falls under the scope of networking and internet architecture. 
- cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper proposes an effective second-order cone programming (SOCP)-alternating direction method of multipliers (ADMM) based algorithm to obtain the locally optimal solution, which involves system modeling and control. 
- cs.MM (Multimedia): The paper deals with optimizing the beamforming vectors to improve the performance of a communication network, which is relevant to multimedia applications that require high-quality and reliable communication. 
- cs.CL (Computation and Language): Although the paper does not directly deal with natural language processing, the proposed algorithms involve mathematical optimization and programming, which are relevant to the field of computation and language.
